paper_abstract: Given an undirected graph G=(V,E) with positive edge lengths and two vertices s and t, the next-to-shortest path problem is to find an st-path which length is minimum amongst all st-paths strictly longer than the shortest path length. In this paper we show that the problem can be solved in linear time if the distances from s and t to all other vertices are given. Particularly our new algorithm runs in O(|V|log|V|+|E|) time for general graphs, which improves the previous result of O(|V|(2)) time and takes only linear time for unweighted graphs, planar graphs, and graphs with positive integer edge lengths.
paper_title: A Simpler and More Efficient Algorithm for the Next-to-Shortest Path Problem
